I'd be happy to help! If you're in the mood for a movie set in Massachusetts, I'd recommend checking out "The Queen". This film is a captivating drama that delves into the life of Queen Elizabeth II after the death of Princess Diana and features an outstanding performance by Helen Mirren.

Another interesting option might be "Little Women," which is a classic tale set in post-Civil War America, focusing on the lives and growth of four sisters. The movie is filled with heartwarming moments and strong performances. Enjoy your movie night!

It sounds like you're looking for a thought-provoking war movie from recent times. Both "Saving Private Ryan" (1998) and "Born on the Fourth of July" (1989) are excellent choices that might suit your preferences.

In "Saving Private Ryan," you'll find a gripping story about a team of soldiers sent on a mission behind enemy lines during WWII, starring Tom Hanks. On the other hand, "Born on the Fourth of July" is based on the true story of Ron Kovic, a soldier paralyzed in the Vietnam War who becomes an anti-war activist. This film stars Tom Cruise and provides a deep exploration of the human cost of war.
